intro: Cypella gracilis, commonly known as the slender cypella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, delicate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cypella gracilis is often found in grassy areas and along the edges of woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
